thread.title: Buffalo Beauts lose, 5-2
thread.title_full: Buffalo Beauts lose, 5-2 - Sports - The Buffalo News

author: buffalonews
title: Buffalo Beauts lose, 5-2
text:
The Buffalo Beauts hung with the Connecticut Whale for two periods before dropping a 5-2 decision to their National Women’s Hockey League opponent Sunday afternoon at HarborCenter.
Buffalo trailed the rest of the way after a power-play goal by Sam Faber gave the Whale a 2-1 lead at 10:32 of the second period.
Kate Buesser’s goal made it 3-1 at 12:14 before Buffalo closed the deficit on a Kelley Steadman goal with 2:59 left in the second period. Meghan Duggan and Shelby Bram assisted on the tally.
Connecticut extended the lead to 4-2 on Molly Engstrom’s third period power-play goal. Kelly Stack assisted. The Whale added an empty net goal in the final minute.
The Whale struck for the game’s first goal at 4:10 of the opening period when Alyssa Wohlfeiler scored with Lindsay Berman assisting. Duggan evened things for Buffalo with 3:48 left in the period with Steadman assisting.
Rich Cleland, CEO of ECMC, dropped the ceremonial first puck before Sunday’s game at the downtown facility.
The Beauts (0-2) will face the Boston Pride at HarborCenter at 3:30 p.m. on Sunday. Buffalo dropped its opener to the Pride on Oct. 11 at HarborCenter.
